snippet: The city has been ordered within a matter of days to release police video of the fatal shooting of a black 17-year-old by a white police officer.
abstract: City of Chicago is under court order to release police video of 2014 fatal shooting of black teenager Laquan McDonald by white police officer; video, which city has tried to keep from public for months, reportedly shows officer shooting teen 16 times, even after his body had fallen to street; Mayor Rahm Emanuel, in apparent anticipation of protests, has condemned officer involved and urged prosecutors to take action before release of video.

byline.original: By MONICA DAVEY and MITCH SMITH

lead_paragraph: The city has been ordered within a matter of days to release police video of the fatal shooting of a black 17-year-old by a white police officer.

headline.main: Chicago Set for Protests Over Shooting by the Police
headline.print_headline: Chicago Set for Protests Over Shooting by the Police
